reference.title: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD system procedure
reference.shortdesc: The SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD system procedure resets a password that has expired or has been forgotten.

section.p: This procedure is used in conjunction with NATIVE authentication. For details about NATIVE authentication, see derby.authentication.provider and "Using NATIVE authentication" in the .

section.title: Syntax
section.codeblock: SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_RESET_PASSWORD(IN USERNAME VARCHAR(128), IN PASSWORD VARCHAR(32672))
section.p: No result set is returned by this procedure.

dlentry.dd: A user name that is case-sensitive if you place the name string in double quotes. This user name is an authorization identifier. See "Authorization identifiers, user authentication, and user authorization" in the for more information about how these names are treated.

section.title: Execute privileges
section.p: If authentication and SQL authorization are both enabled, only the database owner has execute privileges on this procedure by default. See "Using NATIVE authentication," "Enabling user authentication," and "Setting the SQL standard authorization mode" in the for more information. The database owner can grant access to other users.
